answer:
<p>DOM Events describes 3 phases of event propagation: Capturing phase  the event goes down to the element. Target phase  the event reached the target element. Bubbling phase  the event bubbles up from the element.</p>
<p><a href="https://i.stack.imgur.com/LsIr2.png" rel="noreferrer"><img src="https://i.stack.imgur.com/LsIr2.png" alt="enter image description here"></a></p>
data.title: What is event bubbling and capturing?
data.content: <p>What is the difference between event bubbling and capturing? When should one use bubbling vs capturing?</p>
